page.title: 03WILDLIFE, ST.BREWARD AREA. 2
page.content: { COMMON BUZZARD. THE BUZZARD IS THE BIGGEST BIRD OF PREY IN CORNWALL AND HAUNTS MOORLAND, MOTORWAYS AND FARMS.THE BUZZARD LAYS 2_4 EGGS AND THE CHICKS LEAVE THE NEST AT 40_41 DAYS. THEIR MAIN DIET CONTAINS MICE AND OTHER SMALL RODENTS INCLUDING RABBTS. IT IS INTERESTING TO NOTE THAT THE BUZZARD WILL SIT OUTSIDE THE HOLE OF A MOUSE SOMETIMES WITHOUT MOVING FOR HOURS UNTIL IT SUCEEDS IN OUTWITTING ITS WEARY PREY.{LENGTH:53CM { WINGSPAN:1METRE 17CM TO 1METRE 37CM. {GREEN WOODPECKER THE GREEN WOODPECKER IS A SMALL BRIGHT SECRETIVE BIRD WHICH DARTS AROUND THE WOODLAND AREA.THE SMALL BIRD WHICH IS EMARALD GREEN IN COLOURLAYS 5_7 EGGS WHICH ARE INCUBATED FOR 15_17 DAYS. THE CHICKS ARE BORN BLIND & NAKED.THE DIET CONTAINS BEETLES AND SUCH LIKE.{ {LENGTH:34CM. CONTINUED ON PAGE 4
